intro: Solanum ovandense, commonly known as the ovandense nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth margin, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into berries. The berries are initially green and turn red when mature, containing several seeds within a fleshy pulp.
